snippet: Major media companies, including Condé Nast, Yahoo and Hulu, are promoting online video programming on a large scale, but it is not clear whether advertising dollars will follow.
abstract: Major media companies like Conde Nast, The Wall Street Journal, and Univision are promoting online video programming on a large sale, presenting ambitious slates of original programming to advertisers for the first time; companies that were already producing Web content, like Yahoo and Hulu, are greatly expanding offerings, but it is unclear if strategy will be able to attract advertising dollars.

byline.original: By LESLIE KAUFMAN and TANZINA VEGA

lead_paragraph: Major media companies, including Condé Nast, Yahoo and Hulu, are promoting online video programming on a large scale, but it is not clear whether advertising dollars will follow.

headline.seo: Media Giants Chase Online Ads With Original Shows
headline.main: Media Giants Chase Online Ads With Original Shows
